Karax -- Single page applications for Nim.

Imports

kdom, vdom, jstrutils, compact, jdict, vstyles

Types

KaraxInstance = ref object
  surpressRedraws*: bool
  when defined(stats):
underlying karax instance. Usually you don't have know about this. Source   Edit   
RouterData = ref object
  hashPart*: cstring         ## the hash part of the URL for routing.
  queryString*: cstring      ## The search string, can be used for passing data to karax
information that is passed to the 'renderer' callback Source   Edit  

Vars

kxi {.exportc: "kxi__".}: KaraxInstance
The current Karax instance. This is always used as the default. Note: Within the karax DSL always a symbol of the name kxi is assumed, so if you have a local karax instance to use instead in your 'buildHtml' statement, it needs to be named 'kxi'. Source   Edit  

Procs

proc addEventHandler(n: VNode; k: EventKind; action: EventHandler;
                     kxi: KaraxInstance = kxi) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Implements the foundation of Karax's event management. Karax DSL transforms tag(onEvent = handler) to tempNode.addEventHandler(tagNode, EventKind.onEvent, wrapper) where wrapper calls the passed action and then triggers a redraw. Source   Edit   
proc addEventHandler(n: VNode; k: EventKind; action: proc ();
                     kxi: KaraxInstance = kxi) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Implements the foundation of Karax's event management. Karax DSL transforms tag(onEvent = handler) to tempNode.addEventHandler(tagNode, EventKind.onEvent, wrapper) where wrapper calls the passed action and then triggers a redraw. Source   Edit   
proc avoidDomDiffing(kxi: KaraxInstance = kxi) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
enforce a full redraw for the next redraw operation. This can be used as a temporary way to workaround DOM diffing problems or to avoid the DOM diffing when you already know it should use a completely new DOM. This is an experimental API. Source   Edit

proc setForeignNodeId(id: cstring; kxi: KaraxInstance = kxi) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Declares a node ID as "foreign". Foreign nodes are not under Karax's control in the sense that Karax does not attempt to perform structural checks on them. Source   Edit

proc setupErrorHandler() {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Installs an error handler that transforms native JS unhandled exceptions into Nim based stack traces. If useAlert is false, the error message is put into the console, otherwise alert is called. Source   Edit
